txt.en: 'A fine tale. Hállkell, have you a story to tell too?'
Instance: A Beorninghús Tradition
'[placeholder], you have been quite helpful to many folks in the North.'
'Neigh.'
'What say you Gandalf and Legolas, of [placeholder]?'
'Over here, [placeholder].'
'Nicker.'
'You enchanted Beorn with your tales, I would very much like to hear one, Gandalf.'
'All right everyone, let us get to work!'
'A fine story! Now I know how Beorn felt when he welcomed you, Gandalf, and fourteen of your company into his lodge!'
'This food is delicious, Gírta.'
'The food is all prepared and ready for eating!'
'Yes, yes, but it is still delicious!'
'Now Sterkist, you should know I did not make this entire feast alone. We all helped, you included!'
'Certainly. Some have heard this one before, I think....'
'Ha, ha!'
'Langhár and I left the company of the Elves in Felegoth.'
'Astonishing!'
'But then, we were ambushed by the trees themselves!'
'Langhár escaped but not before I was captured by the mythical Taurogrim!'
'Thank the bees, Langhár and [placeholder] came to my rescue when they did.'
'Else, that would have been the last of me!'
'Pass the taters please.'
'I am sure it would not trouble Grimbeorn for an old wizard to listen to a story or two.'
'My tales with [placeholder] are numerous. Many I am not sure you would believe!'
'I would much like to listen, rather than speak, this night.'
'Oh very well, twist the old man's arm....'
'On the march to the Black Gate of Mordor, I worried the Enemy at Minas Morgul would attack the Host from the rear.'
'I convinced Aragorn, the King of Gondor, and [placeholder] here to delve into the Morgul Vale.'
'We stood at the very doorstep of Minas Morgul, upon the only bridge wide enough for armies of the Enemy.'
'Valiantly we fought foes and destroyed the bridge, to protect the Host as they moved ever through North Ithilien.'
'Woof!'
'Sorry I am late!'
'Ruff!'
'Around the time Sterkist befell the Taurogrim, I too ran into trouble.'
'Yip!'
'Elf traders and I were escorting supplies and provisions from the Beorning-lands.'
'We made it through the Forest Gate, but not much further!'
'Spiders attacked the Elves viciously, tearing them limb from limb!'
'I tried to fight them off, but I could not save my companions.'
'Then [placeholder] rescued me from shock and escorted me back to Felegoth.'
'I am glad that [placeholder] is here with us, that is certain!'
'Baa!'
'I agree!
'Baa baa!'
'Baa!'
'It was kind of Grimbeorn to extend his welcome to me, on my father's behalf.'
'It was not long after that the Easterlings prepared an ambush for all of us.'
'If not for [placeholder] spotting the ambush, the Easterlings may have been successful.'
'We surprised the raiding party, fought valiantly, and got the upperhand.'
'The road to the Black Gate was clear.'
You hear the shuffling of hooves and paws growing louder and louder
The guests are starting to arrive!
'What is another guest, so long as the tale continues? Ha, ha!'
'Eat, eat! I will ask for no more tales to be told at this feast.'
'Now, both Elves and Eagles work with us to protect our home.'
'Gandalf, Legolas, [placeholder], you are all to thank for making the Beorning-lands safer.'
'Thank you for a feast and a fine evening, each and every one of you.'
'I thank you for gathering with me to feast and tell tales.'
'It is a tradition we honour, for Beorn himself had done the same and learned much from tales spoken over a feast.'
'Now let us eat!'
'Perhaps a story while we eat, Sterkist?'
